_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The four lakes [an4.104:5.7]: One is shallow but appears deep
One is deep but appears shallow
One is shallow and appears shallow
One is deep and appears deep
The four people similar to lakes [an4.10: A person shallow but appears deep
A person deep but appears shallow
A person shallow and appears shallow
A person deep and appears deep
The characteristics of a person shallow: Impressive when going out and coming back
Impressive when looking ahead and aside
Impressive when bending and extending the limbs
Impressive when bearing the outer robe, bowl, and robes
Don’t really understand: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’
The characteristics of a person deep but: Really understand: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’
The characteristics of a person shallow: Don’t really understand: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’
The characteristics of a person deep and: Really understand: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’
